title: New Champion Chamille
body:

My girlfriend asked me if it was a new {{champion:61}} skin

I guess now we know who C is from Caitlyn's lore. Also, Camille is the game's first literal blade runner.

As for how she turns out, I hope she's an assassin. Her whole comic is literally all about her assassinating a high-profile Zaunite baron. As much as I absolutely love Riot's recent additions and overhaul to the lore, there have been instances where a champion's presentation made them look completely different to how they play: Ekko, for example, is more of a light fighter in the lore, as he uses his Z-drive to try again and again, and his video depicts him dueling a vigilnaut, i.e. a tanky dude, but in practice he's an assassin whose long-cooldown ult is often used to kill.
"C" is a burglar/thief. Camille is more in line as an assassin or secret police type. Not sure why everyone is jumping to say it's her even thought it doesn't line up.

As stated in Caitlyn's lore, "C" performed some high-end heists. I'd say breaking into an aristocrats home and murdering someone would count as a heist.

Plus, when it comes down to the crime report, do you honestly expect that the news outlets to receive information per "Zaunite crime lord murdered during engagement with native aristocrat!"

Naw, they'd probably get "Newly engaged man murdered during home break-in" or something. Cait may know more, but I doubt she'd let on the full truth the public, for the stability of Piltover's "machine".
Heists are robberies. Assassinations are not heists.

>in practice he's an assassin whose long-cooldown ult is often used to kill.

And in reality, he's a full-tank.
But Ekko in practice IS a light fighter.

I agree, he usually ends up playing much more like a fighter than an assassin, whether or not he builds for damage. He has a lot of the hallmarks of a light fighter, too: lots of situational defenses, persistent mobility, good DPS, a focus on autoattacks, etc. However, he was designed to be an assassin, which is also why he was given a high cooldown and a nuke on his ultimate. 

Perhaps this is something for another thread, but I feel Ekko would likely be better off if his kit received further changes to shift him into light fighter space, and among those changes I'd really like for his ult to have a much shorter cooldown, at a cost to its nuke and perhaps to his power elsewhere. We already have Zed for assassins who go all in for the kill and escape by pressing a button for a 1000+ range blink; I think it would be much more interesting if Ekko were closer to how he was in the video, i.e. a relatively weak, scrappy fighter who'd rewind time to give himself another chance.
I actually rather like the sound of that, though it would require more changes than just what you suggested, having his ult be used more often for less pay off might be interesting.

Also, Camille is the game's first literal blade runner.

I don't mind the scissor feet being completely unoriginal... she just looks so _plain_ in design.

What is she? A woman with a tight-suit... yet with scissor legs... that's it.

Imagine if she wore a super fancy styled dress, a cool-looking top-hat (or bowler cap) and _then_ have these cool scissor legs? It totally spices things up!

But NOPE. Riot goes for the plainest possible design (the scissor feet are unoriginal but pretty cool TBH, just so much potential wasted). I just hope her 1350 skin will look a lot better.

Thought process on her design:

1. Someone on the boards suggested a Vi - like character with mechanical boots instead of gauntlets, complete with a kit similar to what it seems Camille is going to have anyway.

2. As with Kindred, Riot took a perfectly reasonable design and figured they didn't want to be accused of stealing this idea, so they changed it too much.

3. Apparently the much less reasonable sword-legs design was their writers', designers', and gameplay developers' best idea to replace boots. It also appears that one does not need to be necessarily good at spotting reasonable ideas, or coming up with similar but still reasonable ideas in order to work at Riot Games.

That is just your opinion, though.
I think Kindred is better designed than the original fan idea by far. All comes to tastes.
And mechanical boots.... Well, you can't please everyone. If she had mechanical boots like in fan concept, many people would yell it is completely unoriginal because of Vi.

I didn't say Kindred was bad, just changed too much from an idea. The amount that original design---which didn't have abilities, mind you-- was changed was everything besides the color scheme. 

Sword legs isn't just unoriginal-- it's stupid.  

And it's perfectly fine to be "unoriginal" when the basis is one of their _own_ characters, with a strong connection to the technology available in the lore. But in a city known for its technological and scientific advances being well above the rest of the world, sword replacements for legs are about as unfit as you can possibly get. 

Hell, just stumps with no addition would make more sense than this.


And how is this "just my opinion"? This is very clearly based on the design given a few years back for a like champion, even down to the grappling hooks just replacing the animation of a leap suggested by the creator.

While a little more negative than others, your post is really well argued.
